Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: gokuzun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here so many times. Friendly staff, fine aroma for sleep, nice breakfast. But there is not a private park place of hotel. Be aware of mafiatic parking parasites.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean rooms, but this is a motel not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: PiyaliDasgupta
Reviews.Content: Metropol hotel is close to the riverside and is 1-2 kms from Aya Sofiya and Blue Mosque. The rooms are clean but very tiny, elementary and do not have any amenities for Tea/Coffee etc. The whole place has a old, worn out feel to it. Located in a congested narrow lane the view from the room is very bad, mostly overlooking under construction buildings, storage area on other areas, cramped up houses. The breakfast buffet needs more variety and freshness. The staircase is dirty and reception areas are dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms. Tiny Breakfast. Convenient Location.”
Reviews.Author: IndianaSud
Reviews.Content: If u r backpacking, and need a room at cheap price, then u may opt for Metropole. Its located conveninetly near the riverside, main road which has lot of eating options, and is 5 mins away from Aya Sofiya and Blue Mosque. Rooms are very tiny, and if u r 2 people, with big suitcases or luggage, u may be constrained for space. Bath is also very tiny. The staircase is dirty, and the elevator doesnt give u a safe feel. However the rooms are clean, even if outside the rooms, and the reception areas are dirty. Pls ask for a room away from the street as the night can be noisy with some construction work which was on during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Masha80
Reviews.Content: highly recommended in the heart of old city, nice clean room, good friendly staff especially waiter "serkan", average breakfast but no doubt I'll go back very close for all the attractions (galata bidge & tower, bosphure docks, sultan ahmet area) and all walking distance i didn't use any transporation during my 3 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: BAA78660
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is close to the Tram, and major througfare. Major attractions are within walking distance. The breakfast that was provided was adequate, and staff was helpful. The rooms are rather tiny but clean. Biggest complaint was the construction of the tunnel nearby that went on all night and the rock hard mattresses. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little 3 star hotel close to main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Pswiss25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after a hiking holiday. It is cosy and welcoming. The main attractions and bazzars are all within walking distance, we did 4 major attractions in one day! Breakfast is basic but OK - juices are dreadful and coffee is weak. Most staff are helpful but a few .. well not everyone loves their job.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, helpful staff and value for money”
Reviews.Author: JesseAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 times during our 6week Turkey and Greece trip. We found the staff were willing to help, most spoke good english. Location to all major Istanbul attractions including: Grand Bazaar, Spice market, blue mosque, topaki palace, cistern & bosphorous, were all within walking distance. Plenty of places to eat. Rooms we had were all good size. We would not hesitate to stay there again. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: irikon
Reviews.Content: For the cost you pay, you really get a good deal. The rooms are very clean, the service is 24 hours and it is better than best. You truly get the quality of a better Holiday Inn at a great price. The breakfast could have more variety, but it's continental - not much you can expect. Lots of restaurants around, all the monuments are a walking distance. If you don't want to walk, the tram is around the corner, and the taxi stand is around the other corner. Convenient location and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 2 star hotel; leaky showers, noisy tunnel construction nearby & poor staff”
Reviews.Author: portpad1
Reviews.Content: Staff were lazy and lied to a fellow traveller about her booking; that they found under a mis-spelt name. The tunnel construction and loading of dump trucks on the opposite corner went till very late in the night. Breakfast was ordinary; but like most Turkish hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but very good location”
Reviews.Author: itsaasif
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Metropol in Istanbul in May - 2010. The Hotel is not very good. Its an average Hotel. The staff is not so friendly. Not good option in Breakfast. The one and only good thing about the hotel is its location. Its very near to almost all the major tourist attractions in Istanbul. If you need more info do write me on [---]

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dougalbean
Reviews.Content: After 9 days travelling through Turkey, we came back to Istanbul and the Hotel Metropol. When we first visited Istanbul we stayed at the Erbil Hotel next door to the Metropol and were rather disappointed with that choice, so we were a bit wary of what the Metropol would provide on our return to the city. I can say though that we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were pleasant, the nights were quiet (even with the local nightlife... we had a street-facing room and it was fine), the rooms were very clean and comfortable and the pillows were of decent quality. The only thing to worry about is the disturbing colour of pink that the rooms are decorated in... but that can be easily overlooked given the other virtues of the hotel. Perfect choice for visiting Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, taking a boat trip on the Bosphorus... all are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug2609
Reviews.Content: We had not booked a hotel in Istanbul and were trying to get one near the train station. After walking past a very expensive hotel and then one which looked unlikely to be standing for much longer we saw Hotel Metropol. The manager was standing outside and welcomed us in to have a look. He showed us the room and gave us a great deal for 4 nights. He was also exceptionally helpful with advice about the best things to see in Istanbul (as well as what to avoid). As we had arrived in the morning- he gave us a free breakfast and it was great to be able to check in straight away. Istanbul was a fantastic city to see and staying at this hotel made it even more of a pleasure. It is near all the best sights, the rooms are very comfortable and clean and the staff were excellent. After having visited many hotels on our trip round Europe over the summer- this was one of the nicest and the staff were the friendliest we met.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean, and close to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: danari420
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the The Metropol Hotel last year on a 3 day trip to Istanbul. Great location, close to all the major attractions (10 minute walk to Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar). The rooms were were on the smaller size, but I tend not to spend a lot of time in any hotel rooms when I'm touring, so this was not a major concern. Breakfast is included in the room rate (which happened to be a very reasonable $60/night). Very basic breakfast with cereal, rolls, fruit, cold cuts, and juice. Don't miss the excellent restaurants close to the hotel (Ã–zler Restaurant in particular). This hotel is an excellent value, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel in heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: richmond_dude
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, you are close to the Topkapi Palace, and thus fairly close to the center of the city sites. Also, the front desk speaks very good English which was important since we spoke no Turkish. Rates were very reasonable and the breakfast was very good with fresh fruits and vegetables, breads, cheeses, and cereals. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but there are several very popular ones within 100 meters. We usually ate in some other areas of the city, but mostly due to our schedule and some specific recommendations that we had for places to eat. The only real downside is that they are not able to purify their water (which is fairly common in Turkey) so that you need to bring your own water to brush teeth/drink and be sure to close your mouth in the shower! I would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Metropol Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ibni Kemal Caddesi, 38 | Sirkeci, Istanbul, Turkey
